questionContent.body: Time before TCP sequence number wraps around for 1 Gbps session

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Wrap-around time = (2^32 * 8) / 1e9 = ~34.35 seconds ? 34 seconds.

questionContent.body: TCP- Seq 230 (60B) lost, next is 290 received. ACK number sent is

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Since first 60B (230-289) lost, ACK for 230 is sent.

questionContent.body: Go-Back-N - 8000km, 500Mbps, 107-bit packet. Seq # bits needed

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: 200 packets can be in-flight -> need 201 seq #s -> needs 8 bits.

questionContent.body: Stop-and-wait with 106 bps, 1000B packets. Efficiency = 25%. One-way delay =

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: 8ms trans time; total = 32ms; 2x + 8 = 32 -> x = 12ms.

questionContent.body: If segment with Seq=230 (60B) is lost, and next segment (Seq=290) is received. ACK sent is

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP sends ACK for expected byte -> 230.

questionContent.body: In TCP, if LastByteSent=10240 and LastByteAcked=8192, cwnd=4KB, advertised window=6KB. Sender window

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Sender window = min(cwnd, awnd) - (sent - acked) = 4096 - 2048 = 2048.

questionContent.body: If cwnd=32KB, MSS=2KB, RTT=100ms. Time to regain cwnd after timeout

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Takes ~11 RTTs to grow from 1 MSS to 32KB again.

questionContent.body: In AIMD, if timeout occurs during 5th transmission, what is cwnd at 10th transmission

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: After timeout, slow start resets and cwnd grows linearly.

questionContent.body: Which one of the following is a version of UDP with congestion control

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: DCCP (Datagram Congestion Control Protocol) adds congestion control to UDP-like functionality.

questionContent.body: cwnd growth after slow start follows a saw tooth pattern called ____________________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP follows AIMD-additive increase, multiplicative decrease-for efficient and fair congestion control.

questionContent.body: A later version of TCP, called ______ TCP, made an extra optimization on the _______ TCP

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: New Reno TCP enhanced Reno's fast recovery for multiple packet losses.

questionContent.body: In Reno TCP, on receiving a new (non-duplicate) ACK in fast recovery, TCP __________________________

questionOptions.body: Stays in this state, cwnd grows additively
Stays in this state, cwnd grows exponentially
Moves to congestion avoidance, deflating cwnd to ssthresh

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Reno exits fast recovery and enters congestion avoidance after new ACK.

questionContent.body: In Reno TCP, if a timeout occurs during fast recovery, TCP _____________________________________

questionOptions.body: Stays in this state, cwnd grows additively
Stays in this state, cwnd grows exponentially

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Timeout indicates severe congestion; TCP resets and enters slow start.

questionContent.body: In Reno TCP, if duplicate ACKs continue in fast recovery, TCP _____________________________________

questionOptions.body: Stays in this state, cwnd grows additively
Stays in this state, cwnd grows exponentially
Moves to congestion avoidance, deflating cwnd to ssthresh

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In fast recovery, Reno increases cwnd by one MSS for each duplicate ACK-exponential growth.

questionContent.body: The ___________ treated timeout and arrival of 3 duplicate ACKs differently

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Reno TCP reduces cwnd to ssthresh on duplicate ACKs but resets to 1 MSS on timeout.

questionContent.body: The ___________ added a new state to the congestion control FSM, called the fast recovery state

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: New Reno TCP improves recovery from multiple losses by entering fast recovery.

questionContent.body: In ______ TCP, slow start begins with cwnd = 1 MSS and ssthresh to a preset value (e.g., 64 KB)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Reno TCP sets ssthresh to a threshold and begins with slow start phase.

questionContent.body: ________ treats the two signs of congestion detections, timeout and three duplicate ACKs, in the same way

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Tahoe TCP resets congestion window to 1 MSS after both timeout and duplicate ACKs, treating them similarly.

questionContent.body: In TCP's ______ algorithm, congestion window increases additively until congestion is detected

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Congestion avoidance increases window linearly after reaching the threshold.

questionContent.body: In TCP's _______ algorithm, the congestion window grows exponentially until a threshold

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Slow start increases cwnd exponentially to probe network capacity.

questionContent.body: In TCP, a probe segment is sent when the _______ timer goes off

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Persist timer sends probe to check if window has reopened.

questionContent.body: In TCP, Karn's algorithm is used for _______ timer calculations

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Karn's algorithm avoids ambiguity in RTT for retransmitted segments.

questionContent.body: In TCP, the _______ timer is needed to handle zero window-size advertisement

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Persist timer is used to probe receiver when window size is zero.

questionContent.body: In TCP, the _______ timer prevents a long idle connection

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Keepalive detects broken connections that are idle.

questionContent.body: In TCP, urgent data requires URG bit set in the _______ field

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The URG bit is part of the Control field and enables the urgent pointer.

questionContent.body: Multiply the TCP header length field by _______ to find header size in bytes

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP header length is in 32-bit words; multiply by 4 to convert to bytes.

questionContent.body: In TCP, there can be ______ RTT measurement(s) in progress at a time

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Multiple RTT measurements may occur for multiple outstanding segments.

questionContent.body: In modern TCP, retransmission occurs if timer expires or ______ duplicate ACKs are received

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Fast retransmit triggers on three duplicate ACKs.

questionContent.body: Clark's solution can solve the silly window syndrome created by the ________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Clark's solution prevents the receiver from advertising small window sizes.

questionContent.body: Nagle's algorithm can solve the silly window syndrome created by the _________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Nagle's algorithm reduces small packet transmission caused by the sender.

questionContent.body: In TCP, the window should not be _________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Shrinking the TCP window may confuse sender and cause data loss.

questionContent.body: In stop-and-wait, send and receive window sizes are ______

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Only one frame is sent and acknowledged at a time in Stop-and-Wait.

questionContent.body: In TCP, size of send window is the ________ of rwnd and cwnd

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Sender window = min(receiver window, congestion window).

questionContent.body: In TCP, one end can stop sending while still receiving. This is called a ______ termination

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Half-close allows TCP connection to terminate sending but keep receiving.

questionContent.body: In TCP, a FIN + ACK segment consumes _____ sequence number(s) if it does not carry data

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: FIN+ACK consumes one sequence number (for FIN only).

questionContent.body: In TCP, a FIN segment consumes ____ sequence numbers if it does not carry data

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A FIN segment consumes one sequence number even without data.

questionContent.body: The connection establishment procedure in TCP is susceptible to a serious security problem called the ___

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: SYN flooding is a common DoS attack exploiting TCP handshake.

questionContent.body: In TCP, an ACK segment, if carrying no data, consumes ______ sequence number(s)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: ACK without data does not consume sequence number.

questionContent.body: In TCP, a SYN + ACK segment consumes _____ sequence numbers

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: SYN+ACK consumes two sequence numbers: one for SYN and one for ACK.

questionContent.body: In TCP, a SYN segment consumes _____ sequence number(s)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: SYN segment consumes one sequence number to initiate the connection.

questionContent.body: TCP ACK number defines the sequence of the ______ byte expected

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP acknowledges the next expected byte.

questionContent.body: A link transmits 4000 frames/sec, each slot 8 bits. TDM rate
Station A uses 32B packets, RTT = 40ms, bandwidth = 64 kbps. Optimal window size

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: From utilization formula, window size ? 11, closest option is 10.

questionContent.body: Which of the following statements are TRUE about TCP 3-way handshake

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Server transitions LISTEN -> SYN_RCVD -> ESTABLISHED; SYN+ACK loss breaks connection.

questionContent.body: Which statements are TRUE? TCP handles flow & congestion, etc

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP handles both; UDP doesn't; Fast Retransmit, Slow Start for congestion too.

questionContent.body: Token bucket- 1MB cap, 10MB/s rate, max 20MB/s. Time to send 12MB

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: 1MB sent instantly; 11MB at 10MB/s = 1.1s.

questionContent.body: On TCP connection- cwnd=4KB, awnd=6KB, LastSent=10240, LastAcked=8192. Window size

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Bytes in flight = 2048; window = min(4096, 6144) - 2048 = 2048.

questionContent.body: Max size of data application layer can pass to TCP layer

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP can segment large data, so application can pass arbitrarily large payload.

questionContent.body: Which statements are TRUE TCP handles both flow and congestion, etc

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP handles both; UDP doesn't; Fast Retransmit is for congestion; Slow Start is for congestion only.

questionContent.body: Which is true about TCP timeout value

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP dynamically estimates RTT for adaptive timeout.

questionContent.body: A token bucket has 1MB capacity. Max rate = 20MB/s. Tokens arrive to sustain 10MB/s. Time for 12MB send

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: 1MB sent instantly, 11MB at 10MB/s ? 1.1s.

questionContent.body: Packets of same session may be routed differently in

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Both TCP and UDP use IP - routes may differ.

questionContent.body: Which system call sends the SYN packet in TCP

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: connect() starts the 3-way handshake by sending a SYN.

questionContent.body: A layer-4 firewall CANNOT

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: L4 firewall can't filter based on user identity - that's L7's job.

questionContent.body: Which of the following is a transport layer protocol

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: SCTP is a transport layer protocol used for reliable, message-oriented communication.

questionContent.body: Socket-style API for Windows is called ____________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Winsock is the Windows implementation of the socket API.

questionContent.body: An endpoint of an inter-process communication flow across a computer network is called __________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A socket is one endpoint in a two-way communication link.

questionContent.body: Transmission Control Protocol __________

questionOptions.body: receives data as a single stream

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP provides reliable, ordered delivery, uses a 3-way handshake, and treats data as a byte stream.

questionContent.body: The __________ state in Reno TCP is between slow start and congestion avoidance

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Congestion avoidance begins after slow start threshold is reached.

questionContent.body: In congestion avoidance, cwnd grows ______________ until congestion is detected

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Linear growth until packet loss indicates congestion.

questionContent.body: In the slow start algorithm, cwnd grows ______________ until ___________________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: cwnd doubles each RTT until it reaches ssthresh, then switches to congestion avoidance.

questionContent.body: ________ control prevents overloading the network

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Congestion control keeps traffic below capacity.

questionContent.body: In TCP, if ACK value is 200, then byte _______ has been received successfully

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: ACK indicates the next expected byte; so all bytes up to 199 are received.

questionContent.body: In TCP, a retransmission timer is set for ______ segments

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Timers are for data segments, not ACKs.

questionContent.body: In TCP, an ACK segment carrying no data consumes ______ sequence number(s)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: ACK without data does not use sequence numbers.

questionContent.body: UDP is an acronym for _______

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: UDP stands for User Datagram Protocol.

questionContent.body: ________ means producer delivers items when produced; ______ means consumer takes items when ready

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Push/pull terms describe data flow direction between producer and consumer.

questionContent.body: TCP sliding windows are __________ oriented

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP windows use byte-based sequence numbers.

questionContent.body: __________ means accepting items from multiple sources. __________ means delivering to multiple sources

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Multiplexing- many sources to one; Demultiplexing- one to many destinations.

questionContent.body: A socket address is a combination of __________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A socket = IP address + Port Number, not MAC or user addresses.

questionContent.body: A client program normally uses ____________ port number. A server program uses __________ port number

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Clients use dynamic (ephemeral) ports, servers use well-known ones.

questionContent.body: One of the main duties of the transport layer is to provide ____________ communication

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Transport layer enables process-to-process communication.

questionContent.body: The SYN flooding attack belongs to which type of attack

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: SYN Flood is a classic example of Denial of Service attack.

questionContent.body: The inclusion of the checksum in TCP segment is ________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Checksum is mandatory in TCP for error detection.

questionContent.body: What is the protocol data unit for the transport layer

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Segment is used at transport layer (TCP); datagram in UDP context.

questionContent.body: What protocol and port are used when browsing the web

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Browsers use HTTP over TCP, and port 80 is standard for HTTP.

questionContent.body: An ACK number of 1000 in TCP means

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: ACK 1000 means next expected byte = 1000 ? 999 received.

questionContent.body: DNS uses UDP because

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: DNS requests are small and fast; UDP is suitable unless TCP is needed for large responses.

questionContent.body: Which layer of the OSI model is also called the end-to-end layer

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Transport layer enables end-to-end process communication.

questionContent.body: Which of the following is TRUE? TCP connections are full duplex, etc

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP is full duplex, has SACK, and is byte-stream not message-stream.

questionContent.body: Which socket API call makes a TCP socket passive

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: listen() prepares the socket to accept connections.

questionContent.body: Which one uses UDP as the transport protocol

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: DNS uses UDP for faster, stateless queries.

questionContent.body: In TCP slow start phase, the congestion window size

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In slow start, cwnd doubles each RTT.

questionContent.body: Which of the following transport layer protocols is used for email

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: SMTP runs over TCP for reliable delivery.

questionContent.body: The transport layer protocols used for real time multimedia, file transfer, DNS and email are

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: UDP is used where speed matters (real-time, DNS); TCP where reliability matters (file transfer, email).

questionContent.body: Transport layer protocols deal with ____________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The transport layer enables logical communication between processes on different hosts.

questionContent.body: A _____ is a TCP name for a transport service access point

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Port numbers are used to identify service endpoints in TCP.

questionContent.body: User Datagram Protocol is called connectionless because _____________

questionOptions.body: all UDP packets are treated independently
it sends data as a stream

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: UDP packets are independent, and there is no connection setup, making it a connectionless protocol.

questionContent.body: Which of the following are transport layer protocols used in networking

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TCP and UDP are transport layer protocols. FTP and HTTP are application layer protocols.

questionContent.body: Transport layer aggregates data from different applications into a single stream before passing it to _____________

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In the OSI model, the transport layer passes data to the network layer.
